intro: Spongostemma daucoides, commonly known as the African burr or wild carrot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its fruit is a schizocarp, splitting into two one-seeded parts when mature. Spongostemma daucoides is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties.
